# watchBlockWithTransactions() function

Watch for new blocks on a given network. (Includes parsed transactions)

## Example

\`\`\`javascript // this will log out the new block every time a new block is finalized const unsubscribe = watchBlockWithTransactions({ network: "ethereum", onBlock: (block) =&gt; { console.log("new block", block); console.log("new transactions", block.transactions) } }); // later on you can call unsubscribe to stop listening for new blocks unsubscribe();

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function watchBlockWithTransactions({
  onBlock,
  ...sharedBlockParams
}: WatchBlockWithTransactionsParams): () => void;
```

## Parameters

| Parameter                         | Type                                                                          | Description |
| --------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------- |
| { onBlock, ...sharedBlockParams } | [WatchBlockWithTransactionsParams](./sdk.watchblockwithtransactionsparams.md) |             |

**Returns:**

() =&gt; void

an unsubscribe function that will stop listening for new blocks when called
